pullrequest.title: Do not assume that users want dSingle precision for ODE

content.raw: @mxgrey , do we need to enable this flag anywhere else. For example, we may have assumed it was enabled, but will now have to manually enable it?
content.html: @mxgrey , do we need to enable this flag anywhere else. For example, we may have assumed it was enabled, but will now have to manually enable it?

pullrequest.title: Do not assume that users want dSingle precision for ODE

content.raw: The comment [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/129/do-not-assume-that-users-want-dsingle/diff#comment-88188267) was meant to be a reply to this.
content.html: The comment here was meant to be a reply to this.

pullrequest.title: Do not assume that users want dSingle precision for ODE

content.raw:
We'll get a compilation error for any packages that were depending on this flag, since either `dSingle` or `dDouble` **must** be defined for anything that depends on ODE to compile.

I've tested this branch against the default branch of `ignition-physics` and there were no issues. I don’t think any other ignition package is using ODE.

The branch for [this PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/8/) will probably be affected \(this `FindODE.cmake` was originally added for that PR\), but that PR is currently in limbo, and it can be corrected whenever we get around to reviewing it again.
content.html:
We'll get a compilation error for any packages that were depending on this flag, since either dSingle or dDouble must be defined for anything that depends on ODE to compile.

I've tested this branch against the default branch of ignition-physics and there were no issues. I don’t think any other ignition package is using ODE.

The branch for this PR will probably be affected (this FindODE.cmake was originally added for that PR), but that PR is currently in limbo, and it can be corrected whenever we get around to reviewing it again.
